title: Absolute Bagels
dek: Egg bagels orange and fluffy

title: Moe’s Doughs
dek: Family-owned doughnutery.

title: Doughnut Plant
dek: Cake + yeast donuts. Tres leches, very good. Other locations available.

title: Dough Doughnuts
dek: Elaborately decorated yeast donuts. Other locations available.

title: Homecoming
dek: Café + plant store. This is the second block in New York I call “Little Portland.”

title: Peter Pan Donut & Pastry Shop
dek: Known for its donuts but its bagels are better

title: The Brooklyn Barge
dek: A bar to visit at sunset. Ignore the bros.

title: Transmitter Park
dek: Fun fact: Named after WNYC antenna located in the park.

title: Absolute Coffee
dek: Good coffee, I’m told. I don’t drink coffee. They list the farm upstate where their milk comes from.

title: 61 Local
dek: Bar / small bites, Kombucha

title: Bien Cuit
dek: Excellent croissants and French loaves

title: Henry Public
dek: Would be classified as “trying-too-hard old-timey Brooklyn hipster” if their pulled turkey leg sandwich weren’t stellar. Vegetarian sides include deviled eggs and sautéed spinach

title: Table 87 Pizza
dek: Veggie-pizza bursting with veggies. Roasted garlic in a jar.

title: 1 Hotel, Brooklyn Bridge
dek: This rooftop bar has a great view and food things. Enter from the north side of the hotel.

title: Ample Hills, BK Bridge Park
dek: At the south side of the park, summer brings this wonderful Ample Hills outpost to the park.

title: Ample Hills, Gowanus
dek: Local flavors include “IT Came From Gowanus.” Enjoy the rooftop seating.

title: Sunshine Laundromat
dek: Walk through the door at the back of this laundromat to find a pinball bar and Kale-topped pizza.

title: Black Mountain Wine House
dek: A log cabin with a fireplace + outdoor seating.

title: Sottocasa Pizzeria
dek: Neopolitan pizzeria. Really excellent.

title: Best Pizza
dek: Literally
